intro: Hieracium murorum proles oblongum, commonly known as the oblong milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright, hairy stems and yellow-orange flower heads. The plant produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind. It thrives in disturbed soils and can often be found along roadsides and in grassy areas. Its common name reflects its milky sap, which is characteristic of many plants in the daisy family.
